title: FAA investigates hot air balloon crash | Video | kimt.com
text: FAA investigates hot air balloon crash Weather Alert ...Accumulating Snow Tonight into Friday... .Light snow bands are progressing from southeast Minnesota through northeast Iowa and into far southwest Wisconsin this evening. While minimal accumulations are expected within these initial bands, visibilities of less than one mile have been impacting travel conditions. Subsequent accumulating snowfall can be seen spreading through central into eastern Minnesota early this evening. This band with above 1 inch per hour snowfall rates will provide widespread accumulations through southeast Minnesota into western Wisconsin late tonight into Friday morning. 1 to 4 inches of accumulation are possible by dawn on Friday. A 30% chance for a wintry mix and light icing affects portions of northeast Iowa and far southwest Wisconsin. The snow continues east Friday morning, exiting by the afternoon. Higher accumulations near 3 inches remain constrained in far southwest Wisconsin with minimal accumulations elsewhere. Highest storm total accumulations expected in areas of southwest and central Wisconsin with a 30% chance for more than 6 inches. The Friday morning commute will be impacted with snow covered, slippery roads. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Minnesota and central, north central and west central Wisconsin. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 10 AM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Minnesota, visit 511mn.org for road conditions. In Wisconsin, visit 511wi.gov for road conditions. && Currently in Rochester 30°F Cloudy 36°F / 24°F 9 PM 30°F 10 PM 30°F 11 PM 30°F 12 AM 31°F 1 AM 30°F Online Poll © Copyright 2024 [Allen Media Broadcasting](https://allenmediabroadcasting.com/), 1751 Hwy 52 N., Rochester, MN | [Terms of Use](/site/terms.html)| [Privacy Policy](/site/privacy.html) Powered by
